subject: My Progress
msgSnippet: I thought I d start a thread wherein I detail my progress learning QuickScript. I plan to learn it slowly but steadily over time, so my posts will probably be
messageBody:
I thought I'd start a thread wherein I detail my progress learning QuickScript. I plan to learn it slowly but steadily over time, so my posts will probably be sporadic. Since July I've been working my way through the Memrise course. It does have some very annoying errors and idiosyncrasies, but I I've been able to work around them. I've learned 655 out of the 756 words, which puts me well ahead of the other ten people who have attempted the course.


Once I reach the end of the Memrise course, my next step will be to start reading some texts and then a novel in QuickScript. Once I've read an entire book, I'll start trying to write in QuickScript. I'm assuming that learning to write will be much easier once I'm reading at a high level.


At some point in the far future, I may even attempt to download a QuickScript font and memorize which keys correspond to what characters. But I'm definitely going to work on my handwriting first.


What I find interesting is being able to recognize all the characters but still not instantly recognize words, just like a child learning to read and having to sound everything out. So basically, I'm currently at a six-year-old's reading level.
